content: Hi, I just saw that movie (believe it or not) the other day. I was wondering what kind of safeguards the navy has in place to avoivd commo errors like that. The mutiny part on board a nuclear sub was pretty intense. I am sure that navy folk watch and laugh at that movie, but it seemed like it could theorectically happen. Any comments? PS, I used to build and test the pumps for navy subs (Seawolf) and other vessels and thats all I know about navy ships. "When you look into an abyss, the abyss also looks into you." ~~ Friedrich Nietzsche
reply: Hi, I just saw that movie (believe it or not) the other day. I was wondering what kind of safeguards the navy has in place to avoivd commo errors like that. PS, I used to build and test the pumps for navy subs (Seawolf) and other vessels and thats all I know about navy ships. "When you look into an abyss, the abyss also looks into you." ~~ Friedrich Nietzsche

content: quote: Originally posted by sethkonigsbergrn: Anyway, how does the navy prevent problems like that from happening? Well, for us on the USCG Cutter, it was underway Friday night "Pizza Nights". Movies, two beers for each person not on or going on watch. Life was great! Who'd think about any mutiny? Don
quote: Originally posted by sethkonigsbergrn: Anyway, how does the navy prevent problems like that from happening?
reply: Well, for us on the USCG Cutter, it was underway Friday night "Pizza Nights". Movies, two beers for each person not on or going on watch. Life was great! Who'd think about any mutiny? Don
